text: Pierre-Joseph Cambon (10 June 1756 â€“ 15 February 1820) was a French statesman. He is perhaps best known for speaking up against Maximilien Robespierre at the National Convention, sparking the end of Robespierre's reign. title: Pierre-Joseph Cambon
